intro: Robbairea delileana var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers with a yellow center. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves and produces clusters of small, showy blooms. It is typically grown as a bulbous plant and thrives in well-drained soil with partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its unique appearance.
